src:
Ketua Umum PSSI Nonton Timnas U-19, Suporter Teriak Luis Milla
06 Nov 2019, 12:58 by Irsyan Hasyim (Kontributor), Rina Widiastuti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Menjelang pertandingan Tim Nasional Indonesia U-19 atau Timnas U-19 melawan Timor Leste U-19 dalam Kualifikasi Piala AFC U-19 2020 di Stadion Madya, Gelora Bung Karno Senayan, ratusan suporter yang memadati stadion kompak meneriakkan nama pelatih asal Spanyol, Luis Milla.
"Luis Milla, Luis Milla," teriak suporter di Stadion Madya, Jakarta, Rabu, 6 November 2019.
Teriakan itu ditujukan kepada Ketua Umum PSSI Periode 2019-2023, Mochamad Iriawan alias Iwan Bule yang baru tiba di tribun kehormatan. Mantan Kapolda Metro Jaya itu melambaikan tangan kepada suporter Garuda Muda.
Sebelumnya, Iwan Bule memastikan pelatih Tim Nasional Simon McMenemy bakal diganti. Hal itu sesuai dengan hasil rapat Komite Eksekutif PSSI.
Namun pemutusan kontrak pelatih asal Skotlandia itu harus melewati prosedur administrasi. "Tentunya ada tata cara atau prosedur yang harus dilalui," kata Iwan di Hotel Sultan, Jakarta, Rabu, 6 November 2019.
Meski dipastikan kontrak dengan Simon berakhir. Pelatih asal Skotlandia itu akan tetap menangani Timnas Indonesia melawan Malaysia dalam Kualifikasi Piala Dunia 2020 pada 19 November mendatang. "Semoga laga melawan Malaysia kita mendapatkan hasil positif," kata Iwan.
Laga kedua Timnas Indonesia melawan Malaysia di Kualifikasi Piala Dunia 2022 akan menjadi pertandingan terakhir bagi Simon. Federasi saat ini tengah mencari pengganti Simon. Komite Eksekutif akan mendengarkan masukan dari Departemen Teknik PSSI.
Terkait calon penggantinya, Iwan Bule menyebut ada dua nama yang menguat, yakni Luis Milla dan pelatih asal Korea Selatan, Shin Tae-yong. Selain itu, ada beberapa nama pelatih nasional yang diusulkan ke pengurus ke PSSI.
"Nanti mereka baru bisa akhir bulan November karena mereka terkait pekerjaan yang sudah ada yang mereka lakukan," kata dia.
Tata cara penentuan pelatih, kata Iwan Bule, calon pelatih harus melalui proses assessment. "Kalau tidak salah paparan pola dia untuk melatih timnas, sehingga mengeruucut satu nama," kata dia.

IRSYAN HASYIM
text:
PSSI Chairperson Watchs U-19 national team, Supporters Shouted Luis Milla
06 Nov 2019, 12:58 by Irsyan Hasyim (Contributor), Rina Widiastuti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Nearing the U-19 Indonesian National Team or U-19 national team against Timor Leste U-19 in the AFC U-19 2020 Qualification Cup at Madya Stadium, Gelora Bung Karno Senayan, hundreds of supporters who packed the compact stadium chanted the name Spanish coach, Luis Milla.
"Luis Milla, Luis Milla," supporters shouted at Madya Stadium, Jakarta, Wednesday, November 6, 2019.
The cry was addressed to the General Chairperson of PSSI 2019-2023, Mochamad Iriawan alias Iwan Bule who had just arrived at the honorary stand. The former Metro Jaya Police Chief waved goodbye to Garuda Young supporters.
Previously, Iwan Bule ensured that National Team coach Simon McMenemy would be replaced. This is consistent with the results of the PSSI Executive Committee meeting.
But the termination of the Scottish coach's contract must go through administrative procedures. "Surely there are procedures or procedures that must be passed," said Iwan at the Sultan Hotel, Jakarta, Wednesday, November 6, 2019.
Although it is certain the contract with Simon ends. The Scottish coach will continue to handle the Indonesian national team against Malaysia in the 2020 World Cup Qualifiers on 19 November. "Hopefully our match against Malaysia will get positive results," Iwan said.
The second match of the Indonesian national team against Malaysia in the 2022 World Cup Qualifiers will be the last match for Simon. The Federation is currently looking for Simon's replacement. The Executive Committee will listen to input from the PSSI Engineering Department.
Regarding his successor, Iwan Bule said that there were two names that strengthened, namely Luis Milla and South Korean coach Shin Tae-yong. In addition, there are several names of national trainers who are proposed to the management to PSSI.
"Later they will only be able to end of November because they are related to the work they already have," he said.
The procedure for determining the trainers, said Iwan Bule, prospective trainers must go through an assessment process. "If I'm not mistaken, he explained the pattern to train the national team, so that one name was pursed," he said.

IRSYAN HASYIM
